title: North Korean famine
summary: The North Korean famine (Korean: 조선기근), also known as the Arduous March or the March of Suffering[5] (고난의 행군), was a period of mass starvation together with a general economic crisis from 1994 to 1998 in North Korea.[6] During this time there was an increase in defection from North Korea which peaked towards the end of the famine period.
